articles.headline: Gunman Kills 4 Marines at Military Site in Chattanooga
articles.snippet: A 24-year-old man opened fire on a recruiting station in Tennessee, then raced to a second military site where he killed four Marines, prompting a federal domestic terrorism investigation.
articles.abstract: A 24-year-old man opened fire on a recruiting station in Tennessee, then raced to a second military site where he killed four Marines, prompting a federal domestic terrorism investigation.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. — A 24-year-old Kuwaiti-born gunman opened fire on a military recruiting station on Thursday, then raced to a second military site where he killed four United States Marines, prompting a federal domestic terrorism investigation. Three other people, including a Marine Corps recruiter and a police officer, were wounded, according to law enforcement officials.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset, Alan Blinder and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: Guilty Verdict for James Holmes in Aurora Attack
articles.snippet: Mr. Holmes, who killed 12 people and wounded 70 in a shooting rampage in suburban Denver three years ago, was found guilty in a state court.
articles.abstract: Mr. Holmes, who killed 12 people and wounded 70 in a shooting rampage in suburban Denver three years ago, was found guilty in a state court.
articles.lead_paragraph: CENTENNIAL, Colo. — Inside Courtroom 201, the families of the dead and wounded watched in taut silence on Thursday afternoon as the judge shuffled through a stack of verdict forms containing the fate of James E. Holmes, the gunman who slipped into a Colorado movie theater in 2012 and opened fire on their sons and daughters, friends and loved ones.
articles.byline: By Jack Healy and Julie Turkewitz

articles.headline: Reddit Changes Content Rules as Steve Huffman Takes Charge
articles.snippet: Mr. Huffman, who reappeared as chief executive of Reddit, hopes to pull off a turnaround of the popular online message board.
articles.abstract: Mr. Huffman, who reappeared as chief executive of Reddit, hopes to pull off a turnaround of the popular online message board.
articles.lead_paragraph: The return of a founder to a company is a well-worn story line in Silicon Valley.

articles.headline: Google Revenues Up 11% as Earnings Surpass Forecast
articles.snippet: The search company’s new chief financial officer, Ruth Porat, said the results “reflect continued growth across the breadth of our products.”
articles.abstract: The search company’s new chief financial officer, Ruth Porat, said the results “reflect continued growth across the breadth of our products.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Investors have spent the last year telling Google to stop opening its wallet so much. On Thursday, they got their wish.

articles.headline: Trying to Win the Public’s Trust With Autonomous Cars, at 120 M.P.H.
articles.snippet: Engineering a self-driving car is difficult enough. Now the public has to be convinced that the technology works.
articles.abstract: Engineering a self-driving car is difficult enough. Now the public has to be convinced that the technology works.
articles.lead_paragraph: SONOMA, Calif. — Markus Hoffmann, an engineer at Audi, prepared himself for a high-speed run around the Sonoma Raceway here in Northern California.

articles.headline: Convictions Prove Elusive in ‘London Whale’ Trading Case
articles.snippet: An investigation into a trader whose risky bets cost JPMorgan Chase $6.2 billion has ended, but who, if anyone, will be held accountable remains an open question.
articles.abstract: An investigation into a trader whose risky bets cost JPMorgan Chase $6.2 billion has ended, but who, if anyone, will be held accountable remains an open question.
articles.lead_paragraph: The case of the London Whale has ended — with a whimper.

articles.headline: Complications Cloud Possibility of a Movie Based on ‘Watchman’
articles.snippet: Several factors affect the possibility that “Go Set a Watchman” by Harper Lee would be made into a film.
articles.abstract: Several factors affect the possibility that “Go Set a Watchman” by Harper Lee would be made into a film.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Typically, the outsize attention given a novel like “Go Set a Watchman” would set off an immediate scramble in Hollywood for the film rights.
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Samsung Fight Exposes Tension in Asia Over Activist Investors
articles.snippet: A vote in favor of a merger between Samsung C&T and Cheil Industries was a rebuke to Elliott Associates, a hedge fund that wanted to scuttle the deal.
articles.abstract: A vote in favor of a merger between Samsung C&T and Cheil Industries was a rebuke to Elliott Associates, a hedge fund that wanted to scuttle the deal.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — Samsung fended off the challenge of a big activist investor on Friday as the founding family tightened its grip over the sprawling South Korean conglomerate.
articles.byline: By Choe Sang-Hun and Neil Gough

articles.headline: A Tiny Bank’s Surreal Trip Through a Fraud Prosecution
articles.snippet: Abacus Bank discovered a fraudulent loan scheme in 2009 and reported it to regulators. For its trouble, it found itself a target of prosecutors.
articles.abstract: Abacus Bank discovered a fraudulent loan scheme in 2009 and reported it to regulators. For its trouble, it found itself a target of prosecutors.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the heart of New York’s Chinatown, a mortgage closing at the Abacus Federal Savings Bank was just about complete. All had gone smoothly: identifications verified, documents signed, checks exchanged. Only one set of papers still required signatures.

articles.headline: Stowaways and Crimes Aboard a Scofflaw Ship
articles.snippet: Few places on Earth are as free from legal oversight as the high seas. One ship has been among the most persistent offenders.
articles.abstract: Few places on Earth are as free from legal oversight as the high seas. One ship has been among the most persistent offenders.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHIOS, Greece — The rickety raft made of empty oil drums and a wooden tabletop rolled and pitched with the waves while tied to the side of the Dona Liberta, a 370-foot cargo ship anchored far from land in the Atlantic Ocean off West Africa.

articles.headline: Taking Manchester to the Global Stage
articles.snippet: By dedicating the English arts festival to the incubation of new work, its director, Alex Poots, has given the event a distinctive identity.
articles.abstract: By dedicating the English arts festival to the incubation of new work, its director, Alex Poots, has given the event a distinctive identity.
articles.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, England — In the final days of his last season as artistic director of the Manchester International Festival, Alex Poots could not refrain from being an unabashed booster for the city. “Manchester is the original modern city,” he said firmly at a local hotel here, with his successor, John E. McGrath, sitting a few tables away.

articles.headline: At Zappos, Pushing Shoes and a Vision
articles.snippet: Tony Hsieh, C.E.O. of Zappos, is on an uphill mission to remake the company’s culture by banning the boss.
articles.abstract: Tony Hsieh, C.E.O. of Zappos, is on an uphill mission to remake the company’s culture by banning the boss.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a sizzling June morning in Las Vegas, 10 Zappos.com employees sat in an air-conditioned conference room decorated with “Star Wars” memorabilia and a mural of Darth Vader. They had gathered for a weekly meeting to discuss new internal software, the sort of routine get-together that keeps corporate America humming.

articles.headline: Inquiry Focusing on Chattanooga Gunman’s Trip to Jordan in 2014
articles.snippet: The disclosure came as investigators scoured Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez’s past for ties to extremist groups.
articles.abstract: The disclosure came as investigators scoured Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez’s past for ties to extremist groups.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. — Federal investigators on Friday dug into the background and travels of the 24-year-old gunman who they say killed four Marines in an attack on two military sites here, focusing on a seven-month trip he made last year to Jordan and scouring his electronic trail in search of a motive for the killings.
articles.byline: By Timothy Williams, Richard Pérez-Peña and Eric Schmitt
